page.title: 19CUSTOMS 2
page.content: The Rotherfield and Mark Cross Bonfire Society was formed in 1903 and named Bonfire Boys.Crowborough Society was formed in 1887.Lewes is the oldest Bonfire Society in Sussex.25 people belong to Rotherfield and about 90 to Crowborough.Each Society make about 5000 torches every year for all those who take part in processions.Groups throughout Sussex attend these functions.Crowborough's largest bon_ fire was in 1983 and was 10 metres square and 25 metres high.Both Socie_ ties went to Windsor Castle for Queen Elizabeth's Silver Jubilee (1977) and to Buckingham Palace to sing carols to the Royal Family.Money raised at the carnivals is given to charity, & these take place at the end of August & the beginning of September.Everyone dres_ ses up & these are very colourful. Armistice Parades are held in November
